newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH BANKS' 1996 OP PROFIT UP TO FIM 2.6 BLN.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH BANKS' 1996 OP PROFIT UP TO FIM 2.6 BLN.

text.p: Finnish banks's aggregate operating profit after credit losses improved in 1996 to 2.6 billion markka from a slight 40 million markka loss the previous year, the Finnish Bankers' Association said on Wednesday.
Aggregate credit losses declined by 1.5 billion markka to 3.7 billion, it said in a statement. Non-performing receivables fell by 5.6 billion markka to 9.9 billion at the end of 1996.
The figures covered banking groups Merita Oy , the cooperative banks around OKOBANK , state-owned Postipankki Oy, the savings banks and state-controlled Yrityspankki Skop Oy , the association said.
During 1996, these banks cut staff by 12 percent to 28,100 people.
Alandsbanken AB and Interbank Osakepankki will release their 1996 earnings later.
